ADC: Add with carry: A = A + operand + C.
ASL: Arithmetic shift left (A or memory); bit 7 -> C.
BIT: Bit test: sets Z from A & operand; sets N/V from operand (memory forms).
CMP: Compare A with operand (sets flags as if A - operand).
COP: Co-processor call / software interrupt with 8-bit signature (COP vector).
CPX: Compare X with operand (sets flags as if X - operand).
CPY: Compare Y with operand (sets flags as if Y - operand).
DEC: Decrement by 1 (memory, or A in implied form).
INC: Increment by 1 (memory, or A in implied form).
JSL: Jump to subroutine long (24-bit); pushes long return address.
JSR: Jump to subroutine; pushes return address.
LSR: Logical shift right (A or memory); bit 0 -> C.
MVN: Block move (A+1 bytes): copy [src bank:X] -> [dst bank:Y], increment X and Y each byte.
MVP: Block move (A+1 bytes): copy [src bank:X] -> [dst bank:Y], decrement X and Y each byte.
PEI: Push 16-bit value from direct-page indirect address onto stack.
PHB: Push data bank register (DBR) onto stack.
PHD: Push direct page register (D) onto stack.
PHK: Push program bank register (PBR) onto stack.
PLB: Pull data bank register (DBR) from stack.
PLD: Pull direct page register (D) from stack.
REP: Clear selected status bits: P = P & ~imm.
ROL: Rotate left through carry (A or memory).
ROR: Rotate right through carry (A or memory).
RTI: Return from interrupt (restores P and return address; restores bank in native mode).
RTL: Return from long subroutine (restores bank + PC).
SBC: Subtract with borrow: A = A - operand - (1 - C).
SEP: Set selected status bits: P = P | imm.
TCD: Transfer A to direct page register (D).
TDC: Transfer direct page register (D) to A.
TRB: Test and reset bits: Z from A & M; then M = M & ~A.
TSB: Test and set bits: Z from A & M; then M = M | A.
WDM: Reserved/future expansion; currently does nothing (consumes 1-byte signature).
XCE: Exchange carry and emulation flag (toggles emulation/native via E).
